medical_history.chief_complaint: Epigastric non-radiating pain worsening after meals, nausea, vomiting, and diarrhea.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began acutely with epigastric pain that worsened after meals and was accompanied by nausea, vomiting, and diarrhea. Duration and specific changes over time are not detailed.
medical_history.past_medical_history: 1. Depression. 2. Multiple sclerosis. 3. Hypothyroidism. 4. Migraine headaches. 5. Irritable bowel syndrome (asymptomatic at this point). 6. Iron deficiency anemia. 7. Fatty liver. 8. Moderate splenomegaly. 9. PICC line associated thrombus. 10. Mild sleep-disordered breathing consistent with upper airway resistance syndrome.
medical_history.family_history: Father with heart disease, hyperlipidemia, and diabetes; mother with thyroid disorder.
